intro: Corallocarpus grevei, commonly known as the African starfruit or wild starfruit, is a small, deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into star-shaped fruits. The fruits are edible when ripe and have a tangy, citrus-like flavor. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
